page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: The area is served by 2 churches.One is St.Dunstan's, Ashurstwood, and the other is Holy Trinity,Forest Row.There were 2 churches in Ashurstwood until 1973 when the Congregational Church was shut.This was bought by the Anglian Church and it was re-dedicated as St.Dunstan's in Sept.1979.The church is well attended by families and the elderly but young people on their own tend to shy away. The same is true at the Holy Trinity Church. This church was built in 1836. This can seat 350 people. A Christian Community was established in Ashurstwood in 1954 and it moved to its present site ,The Barn,Woodshill Lane, in 1964.
